misconceptions.correct_understanding: The program should read exactly one numeric input (an int or double between 0 and 100) representing a grade from the user.

No variable representing a single grade value
No use of the 0–100 grade range

misconceptions.task: Correct Boolean ranges for A and B

misconceptions.correct_understanding: The program should use if/else-if conditions to check whether the numeric grade is in the A (90–100) or B (80–89) ranges and then branch accordingly.
symptoms: No if/else or Boolean expressions involving a grade
No logic that checks ranges like 90–100 or 80–89
misconceptions.root_cause: Misalignment with the task: implementing a different problem (distance between points) instead of grade classification.
misconceptions.remediation_hint: Introduce conditional statements such as `if (grade >= 90) { ... } else if (grade >= 80) { ... }` to distinguish A and B grades.
misconceptions.confidence_rationale: There are no conditional statements at all, so the A and B ranges cannot be handled.

evidence.snippet: double distance = Math.sqrt((x2 - x1) * (x2 - x1) + (y2 - y1) * (y2 - y1));

misconceptions.name: No default or else case handling F grades
